results.title: Citizen Kane (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Wise, Orson Welles and Mercury Productions
results.brief_description: A faceless journalist sets out to investigate the life of media magnate and failed politician Charles Foster Kane. He seeks to uncover the meaning of “rosebud”, Kane’s last utterance. In turn satire, tragedy and gothic comedy, Citizen Kane is a triumph of disjointed, non-linear narrative in which the form becomes the theme, an ironic reflection upon the success ethic and the crushing weight of materialism. In drawing upon the tradition of classical narrative, while at the same time violating some of the expectations in the viewer’s reception of such narrative, Welles ultimately assured “Citizen Kane” of its place as a watershed in modern cinema. Credits: script-Herman J. Mankiewicz, Orson Welles; music-Bernard Hermann; photography-Gregg Toland; editors-Robert Wise, Mark Robson. Cast includes: Orson Welles, Joseph Cotten, Agnes Moorehead, Dorothy Comingore, Ray Collins, Everett Sloane.

results.title: Daybreak Express
results.brief_description: A short film that captures the mood of traversing New York City from day to night. Scored to a Duke Ellington track, entitled Daybreak Express, the film recalls a vibrant youthful city at the height of its mid-century pre-eminence. Pure Jazz

results.title: Running and mobility
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Bruce Moir, South Australian Film Corporation and Slater Sound Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into the specific exercises, training and conditioning techniques necessary for proficiency in running. Describes how the body adjusts to new levels of achievement with the proper training. (Photographer, David Foreman ; Script, Terry Jennings ; Editor, Andrew Prowse ; Sound, Rod Pascoe).

results.title: Cherith
results.creator_credit: Francine Penrose, AFTRS and Shirley Barrett
results.brief_description: Not being able to speak in tongues can be embarrassing at the very best of times. But if you are the only member of the congregation who cannot, and you are the daughter of a dynamic Revivalist preacher like Pastor Howard Spong - it’s even more distressing. And that’s just one of Cherith’s problems. This is a serious (and satirical) comedy about fundamentalist religion. This distinguished piece of film making , with a great script, direction and performance, won Best Short Fiction Film, AFI Awards in 1988.

results.title: The Wizard of speed and time
results.creator_credit: Mike Jittlou Productions, Mike Jittlov and Deven Chierighino
results.brief_description: An examination of pixillation technique. From a mountain cave blasts a green wizard, skimming along the highway at incredible speed until slipping on a banana peel. Then from beneath the wreckage of a shattered movie studio, he magically resurrects every piece of equipment and celebrates with song and sparkles.
